channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesota corrections commissioner disputes ICE arrest numbers
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Paul Schnell, commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Corrections, over his agency's dispute of Homeland Security claims around arrest numbers.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Paul Schnell, commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Corrections, over his agency's dispute of Homeland Security claims around arrest numbers.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: How the blockade between Afghanistan and Pakistan is affecting people on both sides
item.description: Borders between Pakistan and Afghanistan have been closed since October, disrupting trade around the region. It's part of a broader dispute over how to handle increasingly active militant groups.
item.content:encoded: Borders between Pakistan and Afghanistan have been closed since October, disrupting trade around the region. It's part of a broader dispute over how to handle increasingly active militant groups.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: A stencil of a handprint in an Indonesian cave is the oldest known rock art
item.description: Scientists have discovered what they say is the earliest known rock art, in a cave in Indonesia. They say the image dates to more than 67,000 years ago.
item.content:encoded: Scientists have discovered what they say is the earliest known rock art, in a cave in Indonesia. They say the image dates to more than 67,000 years ago.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Intagliata

item.title: Oprah opens up about how she stayed grounded when she first rose to fame
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Oprah opens up about how she stayed grounded when she first rose to fame.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Oprah opens up about how she stayed grounded when she first rose to fame.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: States look at banning masked agents, but local police have doubts
item.description: We look at the potential for conflict between local police and federal immigration agents as Democratic states consider banning law enforcement from wearing masks or otherwise concealing their IDs.
item.content:encoded: We look at the potential for conflict between local police and federal immigration agents as Democratic states consider banning law enforcement from wearing masks or otherwise concealing their IDs.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Catherine O'Hara played drunk better than anyone
item.description: O'Hara observed people closely; she found the tics, the mannerisms, the specific beats of drunkenness and used them to open us up to her characters' frailty, their vulnerability, their humanity.
item.content:encoded:
Schitt's Creek.'/>

O'Hara observed people closely; she found the tics, the mannerisms, the specific beats of drunkenness and used them to open us up to her characters' frailty, their vulnerability, their humanity.
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Residents in Nashville still struggle with power outages a week after winter storm
item.description: Residents of Nashville are still struggling to recover from a winter storm as more freezing weather is expected this weekend.
item.content:encoded: Residents of Nashville are still struggling to recover from a winter storm as more freezing weather is expected this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Cynthia Abrams

item.title: After a record-long shutdown last fall, why Democrats were willing to risk another
item.description: The government is set to shutdown at the end of the day Friday. Shutdowns have evolved in recent years from rare collapses of government function to increasingly frequent political tools.
item.content:encoded: The government is set to shutdown at the end of the day Friday. Shutdowns have evolved in recent years from rare collapses of government function to increasingly frequent political tools.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Tim Walz says Trump administration wants to 'twist reality' in Minnesota
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz about the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in his state.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz about the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in his state.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: DOJ says it has met legal obligations with latest Epstein files release
item.description: The Justice Department says it has released more than 3 million pages of materials tied to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, to comply with the law.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department says it has released more than 3 million pages of materials tied to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, to comply with the law.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas
